page.title: 05LAND RECLAMATION AT IBSTOCK
page.content: When the open-cast coal mine at Ibstock is closed in 1990 the contractors will fill in the holes and return the sub-soil and top-soil. The site will be handed over to the Ministry of Agriculture as agricultural land and be left for five years. It may then be sold for farming or development in other ways. A report from Birmingham University suggested that the site could be used to build an Adventure World recreation area. Tourists, they say, would be attracted to North-West Leicestershire and jobs created. This scheme seems impractical as the deep holes need filling and the cliff faces are not stable. However, new ideas may be explored before the future of the site is finally decided.
